description: The consolidated System Security Plan (SSP) document includes all required sections: system information, authorization boundary, network diagrams, security controls implementation details, authorization details, and approval signatures. This document combines unique information from multiple sources to eliminate redundancy while preserving all distinct requirements and details. It provides a comprehensive overview of the system's security posture, ensuring clarity and specificity.

description: Session management configurations include: session timeout and device lock set to 15 minutes of inactivity (AC-11, AC-12), concurrent session limits with 3 for privileged and 2 for non-privileged users (AC-10), re-authentication policy with session timeout limits of 12 hours maximum or 15 minutes inactivity for AAL3, and session timeout and network disconnect configurations for both privileged and user sessions.
mergedFrom: Session timeout and device lock configuration set to 15 minutes of inactivity (AC-11, AC-12)
Concurrent session limits configuration (3 for privileged, 2 for non-privileged) (AC-10)
Re-authentication policy and configuration showing session timeout limits (12 hours maximum or 15 minutes inactivity for AAL3)
Session timeout and network disconnect configuration for privileged and user sessions

description: This document consolidates information on FedRAMP authorization package documentation, including the FedRAMP Package ID, current authorization status, and the type of authorization (JAB or Agency). description: This consolidated document provides FIPS 199 security categorization documentation, including the security categorization analysis, supporting rationale for the High baseline determination, and authorizing official approval (RA-2). FIPS PUB 199 security categorization documentation with supporting rationale for the High baseline determination

description: Evidence of annual review and updates to the following policies and procedures: awareness and training, contingency, and maintenance. Each policy and procedure undergoes a thorough review and update process annually to ensure compliance with current standards and best practices.

description: This consolidated document includes the current audit and accountability policy, procedures, version history, approval records, and last review date. It also documents the designated official responsible for managing these policies and procedures. The policy outlines the requirements for maintaining audit and accountability, while the procedures detail the specific actions and steps to be taken. Version history and approval records ensure transparency and accountability in policy updates. The last review date indicates when the document was last assessed for accuracy and relevance. The designated official is responsible for overseeing the implementation and management of these policies and procedures.
mergedFrom: Current audit and accountability policy document, including version history and approval records
Current audit and accountability procedures document, including version history and last review date
Documentation of designated official responsible for managing audit and accountability policy and procedures

description: This consolidated document provides baseline configuration documentation for all system components, including hardware, software, firmware, network topology, and security control implementations. It includes security configuration checklists and hardening guides such as DISA STIGs, CIS benchmarks, or custom baselines applied to system components. Additionally, it covers security configuration baseline documentation for all systems, components, and services, including DoD STIGs, CIS Level 2 benchmarks, or custom baselines.
mergedFrom: Baseline configuration documentation for all system components, including hardware, software, firmware, network topology, and security control implementations
Security configuration checklists and hardening guides (DISA STIGs, CIS benchmarks, or custom baselines) applied to system components
Security configuration baseline documentation (DoD STIGs, CIS Level 2 benchmarks, or custom baselines) for all systems, components, and services

description: This document provides a comprehensive inventory of critical system assets that support essential mission and business functions. It includes details on maintenance support contracts and spare parts inventory for critical system components. Additionally, it documents the support status of system components, replacement plans for unsupported components, and alternative support arrangements, whether in-house or through external providers.

description: Documentation encompassing evidence of incident response testing conducted within the past six months, including test plans, functional test results, and JAB/AO approval. description: This document consolidates records and procedures for off-site maintenance, repair, or replacement activities, including approval records, media sanitization procedures, nonlocal maintenance approval and monitoring, and strong authentication mechanisms. It covers the approval and monitoring of off-site maintenance sessions, media sanitization for equipment removed for maintenance, and documentation of strong authentication methods such as multi-factor authentication and PKI certificates.

description: This document outlines the automatic activation and notification procedures for various detection and suppression systems, including fire detection, fire suppression for unstaffed facilities, and water detection systems. It details the protocols for automatic activation, notification procedures, and the management of personnel notification lists. The document ensures that all relevant systems are covered, including the activation mechanisms for fire detection systems, suppression systems for unstaffed facilities, and alert mechanisms for water detection systems. It also emphasizes the importance of maintaining clear and specific notification procedures to ensure timely and effective responses.
mergedFrom: Fire detection system automatic activation and notification procedures with personnel notification lists
Fire suppression system automatic activation documentation and notification procedures for unstaffed facilities
Water detection system automated alert mechanisms and notification procedures

description: This document provides a comprehensive criticality analysis of system components, functions, and services at key decision points in the system development life cycle (SDLC). It identifies critical system components, functions, and services, and includes the breadth and depth of analysis for high-value assets. The analysis is crucial for determining restoration priorities and ensuring that critical elements are adequately addressed throughout the SDLC.
mergedFrom: System criticality analysis and restoration priorities documentation
Criticality analysis documentation identifying critical system components, functions, and services at key decision points in the system development life cycle (RA-9)
Criticality analysis documentation performed at key decision points in the SDLC, including breadth and depth of analysis for high value assets

description: Annual vulnerability scan reports covering operating systems, infrastructure, web applications, APIs, and databases, along with privileged access authorization documentation for authenticated vulnerability scanning activities (RA-5, RA-5(5)). These reports include findings from independent assessments and are essential for maintaining system security.
mergedFrom: Vulnerability scan reports from the past 12 months for operating systems, infrastructure, web applications, APIs, and databases (RA-5)

Privileged access authorization documentation for authenticated vulnerability scanning activities (RA-5(5))

description: This document consolidates information on various security controls and mechanisms aimed at preventing data breaches, malicious code execution, and unauthorized memory access. It includes data exfiltration prevention controls and their testing results, configuration documentation for malicious code protection mechanisms utilizing both signature-based and non-signature-based technologies, and details on memory protection controls such as data execution prevention (DEP) and address space layout randomization (ASLR).
mergedFrom: Data exfiltration prevention controls and testing results
Malicious code protection mechanism configuration documentation, including signature-based and non-signature-based technologies
Memory protection controls documentation including data execution prevention and address space layout randomization

description: This document provides comprehensive implementation documentation for system component isolation and segregation, process isolation, and security function isolation. It details the creation of separate execution domains to ensure that system components, processes, and security functions are isolated from each other. This includes guidelines for implementing isolation mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access and maintain the integrity of security functions. The documentation covers the necessary steps and best practices for achieving effective isolation and segregation across different domains.
mergedFrom: System component isolation and segregation implementation documentation
Process isolation implementation documentation showing separate execution domains
Security function isolation implementation showing separation of security and non-security functions

Split tunneling prevention controls and configuration for remote devices

Host-based protection system (HIPS/HIDS/firewall) deployment evidence across all system components
Boundary protection device fail-secure configuration documentation
Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) certificate policy and approved trust anchor list
Mobile code policy defining acceptable and unacceptable mobile code technologies
System time synchronization configuration with NIST authoritative time sources
Denial-of-service protection controls for ICMP flood, SYN flood, slowloris, buffer overflow, and volume attacks
Separation of duties matrix showing role assignments for system administration functions
Services, ports, and protocols inventory with justifications for each
Collaborative computing device remote activation controls and user indication mechanisms
Information sharing controls for shared system resources to prevent unauthorized information transfer
System Security Plan (SSP) document including all required sections per FedRAMP High Baseline requirements
Current system and information integrity policy and procedures, including review and update dates
Vulnerability scanning reports and flaw remediation tracking records for the past 90 days
Evidence of security-relevant software and firmware updates installed within 30 days of release
Configuration management documentation showing integration of flaw remediation processes
Malicious code scanning logs showing weekly scans and real-time scanning at endpoints and network entry/exit points
Alert notifications sent to administrators in response to malicious code detection
System monitoring objectives and monitoring device deployment architecture diagrams
Network traffic monitoring logs for inbound and outbound communications showing continuous monitoring
Wireless intrusion detection system configuration and scanning reports
Evidence of monitoring information correlation across multiple security tools
Host-based monitoring mechanisms configuration on servers, workstations, and mobile devices
US-CERT and CISA security alerts, advisories, and directives received and disseminated in the past year
Security and privacy function verification test results performed at system startup/restart and monthly
Software, firmware, and information integrity verification tool configuration and scan results
Integrity check logs performed at least monthly and during security-relevant events
Cryptographic code authentication mechanisms for software and firmware components
Spam protection mechanism configuration at system entry and exit points
DMARC configuration documentation for outgoing email domains (if applicable)
Information input validation procedures and exception documentation
Error handling procedures and error message logs showing restricted disclosure
System owner and ISSO contact information and organizational chart
Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) Policy and Procedures documentation
Supply Chain Risk Management Plan including risk tolerance, mitigation strategies, roles and responsibilities, and lifecycle security engineering processes
SCRM Team charter or documentation identifying team members, roles, responsibilities, and assigned SCRM activities
Supply chain custody documentation for all devices, including replacement devices, showing integrity verification before introduction to the system boundary
Documented supply chain controls and processes to identify and address weaknesses in supply chain elements
Acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods documentation addressing supply chain risk mitigation
Supplier and contractor risk assessment reports conducted at least annually, including security processes, FOCI analysis, and subordinate supplier assessments
Evidence that supply chain vendors build and test systems in alignment with NIST SP 800-171 or commensurate security framework
Vendor compliance documentation for physical facility access and logical access controls to supplied products
Notification agreements and procedures with supply chain entities for supply chain compromises and assessment/audit results
Documentation of vendor notification process for newly discovered vulnerabilities including zero-day vulnerabilities
Tamper protection program documentation including safeguards for authenticity of software and patches supplied by vendors
Evidence of anti-tamper technologies, tools, and techniques employed throughout the system development lifecycle
System and component inspection procedures and records to detect tampering
Anti-counterfeit policy and procedures including detection and prevention measures for counterfeit components
Vendor plan to protect the development pipeline and ensure authenticity of software and patches
Anti-counterfeit training materials and records for personnel responsible for detecting counterfeit components
Configuration control procedures and records for system components awaiting service, repair, or return to service
Component disposal procedures and documentation including techniques and methods for secure disposal of data, documentation, tools, and system components
